name: Aaron Kwok
description:
'''Aaron Kwok Fu-shing''' (born 26 October 1965) is a [[Hongkongers|Hong Kong]] singer, dancer, and actor, known as one of Hong Kong's "[[Four Heavenly Kings (Hong Kong)|Four Heavenly Kings]]". Active since the 1980s, he has released over 30 studio albums in Cantonese and Mandarin, mostly in the [[dance-pop]] genre, with elements of [[rock music|rock]], [[Rhythm and blues|R&B]], [[soul music|soul]], [[electronica]] and [[List of traditional Chinese musical instruments|traditional Chinese music]].

Concurrently with his music career, Kwok debuted as an actor with a role in the [[TVB]] television drama ''[[Genghis Khan (TVB TV series)|Genghis Khan]]'' (1987). He gained recognition in the film ''[[Saviour of the Soul]]'' (1991), for which he was nominated for a [[Hong Kong Film Award for Best Supporting Actor]]. His notable films include ''[[The Storm Riders]]'' (1998), ''[[China Strike Force]]'' (2000), ''[[Divergence (film)|Divergence]]'' (2005), ''[[After This Our Exile]]'' (2006), ''[[Cold War (2012 film)|Cold War]]'' (2012) and its [[Cold War 2 (film)|2016 sequel]], ''[[Port of Call (2015 film)|Port of Call]]'' (2015), for which he won the [[Hong Kong Film Award for Best Actor]], and ''[[Project Gutenberg (film)|Project Gutenberg]]'' (2018).
